p: Zika virus (ZIKV) is an emerging mosquito-borne arbovirus that causes serious public health consequences. Zika virus is primarily transmitted to people through the bite of an infected Aedes species mosquito ( Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus) [ 1]. Although most infections carry mild symptoms or are asymptomatic, the association between ZIKV and microcephaly and Guillain-Barré syndrome placed ZIKV as a global medical emergency during the 2016 epidemic [ 2– 6]. Currently there is no medicine or vaccine to cure or prevent ZIKV infection. Therefore, infection containment, vector control and personal protection are the most important measures to prevent infections and contain viral spread [ 7].
